How do you test retrofit calls? the tests doesn't wait for the callbacks to be fired?
and yes, I'm actually writing tests now :smile:
<@U04TK850N>: do you not read my blog
:disappointed:
<@U060Q7J2Y>: I'm writing plain unit tests and not espresso tests
oh
Test retrofit calls? Uhhh i test by invoking the presenter method, and the interactor (model/data layer) is a mock implementation
Or mock Web server with mockito
And wait before checking if view method was invoked with appropriate
well, the thing is that the test succeeds cause it doesn't even wait for the response
so a mock server doesn't help me
i think you have to get the test to listen to the correct executor pool or whatever to see if there are additional tasks running (the network call)? which some testing frameworks let you do
but idk in a plain unit test
well... Or I just use a synchronous retrofit call :neutral_face:
You fire real network calls?
disclaimer: i don’t test for that exact reason lol
<@U0548MM6B>: yes
Not sure it should be done in unit tests, unless pinging your own machine :/
why not?
Never did that, always tested via mocks to cover good, bad and edge  cases
network calls are slow
Speed of tests,  what if it's offline
definitely do not hit the network for tests
rule #1 of writing tests
Also if you only run one job on CI, you block colleagues
they instantly become flaky based on the network conditions, server, etc
Unit test test logical units of your code
hm okay, won't be hard to mock this anyway
thx :simple_smile:
